meanings.definition: A division or contrast between two things that are represented as being opposed or entirely different.
meanings.sent1: The dichotomies between night and day are clear to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to understand the dichotomies in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomies in his wardrobe were comical - all black or all bright colors.
meanings.sent4: The political debate highlighted the stark dichotomies in their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used candy to illustrate the concept of dichotomies in nature.

meanings.definition: The process or practice of dividing or distinguishing things into two contrasting groups or sets.
meanings.sent1: His job involved the constant creation of dichotomies in data analysis.
meanings.sent2: The dichotomies in the survey results were unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomies in her organizing style made her desk look chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of color created striking dichotomies in the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomies in the menu made it hard to choose just one dish.
